metadata.title: CVE-2023-32257 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: A flaw was found in the Linux kernel's ksmbd, a high-performance in-kernelSMB server. The specific flaw exists within the processing ofSMB2_SESSION_SETUP and SMB2_LOGOFF commands. The issue results from thelack of proper locking when performing operations on an object. An attackercan leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of thekernel.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
